title: Inference in Simple Regression
contentHtml:
In simple linear regression, we're interested in making inferences about the population slope (β) based on a sample of data.

  • We'll use confidence intervals and hypothesis tests to draw conclusions about the true relationship between the predictor variable X and the response variable Y.

title: Inference in Simple Regression
contentHtml:
In simple regression analysis, we're interested in making inferences about the slope of a linear relationship between two variables.

This is crucial in many real-world applications, including machine learning and artificial intelligence.
name: Simple Regression Slope Formula
problemHtml: Suppose we want to investigate the relationship between hours studied and exam scores. We collect data on 10 students, with their study hours and corresponding scores.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the mean of both variables", "mathHtml": "\(x̄ = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^n x_i\)", "explanation": "This helps us standardize our variables."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the deviations from the means", "mathHtml": "\((x_i - x̄)\) and \((y_i - ȳ)\)"}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Multiply deviations by each other and sum them up", "mathHtml": "\(b = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^n (x_i - x̄)(y_i - ȳ)}{\sum_{i=1}^n (x_i - x̄)^2}\)"}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Divide by the sum of squared deviations", "mathHtml": "\(b = \frac{\sum_{i=1}^n (x_i - x̄)(y_i - ȳ)}{\sum_{i=1}^n (x_i - x̄)^2}\)"}, {"stepNumber": 5, "description": "Calculate the final slope estimate", "mathHtml": "\(b = \frac{0.3}{0.05} = 6\)"} ],
intuition: In simple regression, we're trying to understand how changes in one variable affect the other.

steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the sample slope coefficient", "mathHtml": "\\[ \hat{\\beta} = \\frac{\\sum (x_i-y_i) }{\\sum (x_i-\\bar{x})^2} \\]", "explanation": "This is our best estimate of the population slope." }, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the standard error of the sample slope", "mathHtml": "\\[ \frac{\\sigma_e}{\sqrt{\\sum (x_i-\\bar{x})^2}} \\]", "explanation": "This measures the variability in our estimate." } ],
